result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul A Kolvenbach

defendant.name: Kolvenbach, Paul A
defendant.address: 4528 West Deer Run Drive #201, Brown Deer, WI 53223

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. DPA Violation Report 11.2.2022

Defendant Paul A Kolvenbach in court.  Attorney Ryan Ralph Lee in court for Paul A Kolvenbach.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court to address Justice Point violation. Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared for a review hearing on 11/28/2022 at 10:00 am in Branch 17.
Received and Filed. DPA Violation Report 10.06.2022

Defendant Paul A Kolvenbach in court.  Attorney Ryan Ralph Lee in court for Paul A Kolvenbach.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a review hearing. Defendant is complying with the terms of the agreement. Defendant needs to continue to comply with the terms of the agreement in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 9.14.2022

Defendant Paul A Kolvenbach in court with attorney Ryan Ralph Lee.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court due to court being in receipt of a JusticePoint violation report. Court gives defendant a verbal admonishment. Case remains calendared for a review hearing on September 19th, 2022 at 1:30 PM before Branch 17.
Court is in receipt of a JusticePoint violation report. Court scheduled a hearing to address the violation. Hearing scheduled for August 17th, 2022 at 10:50 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Violation Report 8.10.2022

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review.
  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.   Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Paul A Kolvenbach in court with attorney Ryan Ralph Lee.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed,  Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed, Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver
Received and Filed, Signed DPA Agreement
Received and Filed, Notice of Retainer
